metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2299 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the mpeg_read function in wiretap/mpeg.c in the MPEGparser in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.13 and 1.10.x before 1.10.6 allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service(application crash) via a large record in MPEG data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2299` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark11 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap8 - 1.10.6-1
libwscodecs2 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil9 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-gtk - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.6-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
